page.title: 09POPULATION OF BICESTER.
page.content: At present the population of the town is 17,500 and it is estimated to be 26,000 by 1990. The town changed after the building of the Ordnance Depot in 1941 and many people were encouraged to come to the town in the sixties,by the offer of a civil service job and a house.People came particularly from the north and settled in the town,taking up the 800 houses which belonged to the M.O.D. There are many British Army personnel living in the town.They are stationed at Ambrosden and work in the Ordnance Depot. The U.S.A. Airforce base is at R.A.F. Upper Heyford;a distance of 7 miles from Bicester.Many Americans live within quarters in the town and the R.A.F.quarters at Caversfield are at present leased to the Americans.
